articles.headline: CNN and Chris Cuomo Face Difficult Questions After Anchor’s Suspension
articles.snippet: The network said it was pursuing a “further evaluation” of evidence regarding its star anchor’s efforts to help stave off a sexual harassment scandal that his brother, former Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo, was facing.
articles.abstract: The network said it was pursuing a “further evaluation” of evidence regarding its star anchor’s efforts to help stave off a sexual harassment scandal that his brother, former Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo, was facing.
articles.lead_paragraph: The latest on CNN’s firing of Chris Cuomo.
articles.byline: By Michael M. Grynbaum and John Koblin

articles.headline: Supreme Court Seems Poised to Uphold Mississippi’s Abortion Law
articles.snippet: It was less clear whether the court’s conservative majority would overrule Roe v. Wade, the decision establishing a constitutional right to abortion.
articles.abstract: It was less clear whether the court’s conservative majority would overrule Roe v. Wade, the decision establishing a constitutional right to abortion.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court seemed poised on Wednesday to uphold a Mississippi law that bans abortions after 15 weeks of pregnancy, in what would be a momentous and polarizing decision to roll back the abortion rights the court has defined over the last half century.

articles.headline: U.S. Reports Its 1st Omicron Case, in a California Traveler
articles.snippet: The discovery in San Francisco County prompted the Biden administration to renew calls for everyone to get fully vaccinated and receive a booster, if eligible.
articles.abstract: The discovery in San Francisco County prompted the Biden administration to renew calls for everyone to get fully vaccinated and receive a booster, if eligible.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Omicron coronavirus variant was reported in the United States for the first time on Wednesday in a traveler who had been in South Africa, as scientists around the world study whether the variant is more transmissible or virulent than its predecessors.
articles.byline: By Michael D. Shear, Shawn Hubler and Roni Caryn Rabin

articles.headline: Omicron Could Knock a Fragile Economic Recovery Off Track
articles.snippet: The latest zigzag in the pandemic has already curtailed travel, but its broader impact on growth and inflation isn’t likely to be known for several weeks.
articles.abstract: The latest zigzag in the pandemic has already curtailed travel, but its broader impact on growth and inflation isn’t likely to be known for several weeks.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — This week, Marisha Wallace finally had to admit that her planned five-day ski holiday in Switzerland in mid-December was not salvageable: The Swiss government’s sudden decision to impose a 10-day quarantine on some international travelers meant she wouldn’t be able to leave her hotel or return home to London on her scheduled flight.

articles.headline: Britain Turns to Bankers to Blaze a Green Trail
articles.snippet: The financial industry will be relied on to meet climate goals. NatWest, a lender to oil giants, provides a template.
articles.abstract: The financial industry will be relied on to meet climate goals. NatWest, a lender to oil giants, provides a template.
articles.lead_paragraph: Advocates descended on the streets of Glasgow last month, pressing banks and other financial institutions at 26th United Nations climate summit to be more responsible stewards of the climate. But a bank based just 50 miles east of the Scottish city is already showing what that might look like.

articles.headline: A Journalist, a Philosophy Major and the Mad Scramble for Video Game Consoles
articles.snippet: New gaming consoles remain in short supply this holiday season, spawning cottage industries of tipsters and scalpers making money off their scarcity.
articles.abstract: New gaming consoles remain in short supply this holiday season, spawning cottage industries of tipsters and scalpers making money off their scarcity.
articles.lead_paragraph: A few seconds before noon on Monday, Jake Randall began encouraging people watching his livestream on YouTube to start refreshing Walmart’s website on their computers.
articles.byline: By Kellen Browning and Julie Creswell
